1.text: Whip up your egg binding in a small bowl.

2.text: Dump your raw ground meat in a large bowl.

3.text: Add the egg mixture, Parmesan, and breadcrumbs to the meat and mix well.

4.text: Form 1-inch balls by rolling the mixture in your hands.

5.text: Cook for in a frying pan over medium heat, preferably in your sauce.

6.text: Alternatively, cook meatballs in the oven on a baking rack for 20-30 min at 350F.

7.text: Serve with any carbohydrate, such as spaghetti/pasta, white rice, or a baked potato.

8.text: Add fresh, chopped onion and minced garlic for added flavor depth.

9.text: Mix the 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs with 1/2 cup of milk ahead of time for more tender balls.

10.text: Bake directly in a marinara sauce, covered with cheese, for instant meatball sub material.

11.text: Add a simple glaze to serve the meatballs as their own entree.

12.text: Brown the outside of the meatballs and then freeze them if you need to cook ahead.
